page.title: 03STALL'S FARM
page.content: { Stall's farm}used to be called Ox Stall's farm.It has been a{dairy farm since 1968,when it started with Ayrshire cows. It now has{139 Fresian cows}and{1 {Guernsey cow.}The milk from the cows is sold to Northern Dairies.The farm sends 600,000 litres to the dairy every year.The farm itself has 84 acres but rents other land from neighbouring farms making 120 acres altogether.The area where the farm is situated is too hilly for growing grain, so it is all grass land.The grass is used for silage which is made twice a year and is stored in a big metal shed,with a plastic sheet over it, held down by tyres. The farm has a tractor,mower,a forage harvester,roller and chains and a harrows.The milking parlour can milk 8 cows at one time.
